page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: In this area there are many farms, altogether there are twenty eight. They are mainly crop farms. They grow potatoes, red beet, fodder beet, sugar beet, cereal crops and flower bulbs. There are a few sheep and cattle on the farms but no dairy farms. The land is very light and is easy to work all through the year but in a dry spell crops need watering or they will not grow .There are some specal farms. One farm hatches pheasant and partridge eggs and rears the young chicks to sell. Low moor farm specalises in weaner pigs.Then they sell them for people to rear. We now have turkeys reared in sheds at willow farm.
